replies.msg: Falling in love is like holding a candle. Initially it lightens up the world around you. Then it starts melting and hurt you. Finally it goes off and everything is darker than ever and all you are left with is the burn.
You can’t buy love, but you can pay heavily for it.
You meet everyone twice in this life, when they come and when they go.
When one door closes another door opens; but we so often look so long and so regretfully upon the closed door, that we do not see the ones which open for us.
